name: Jhon Devid
review: This is an overcast day in old growth rainforest, distilled and bottled. Damp wood and leaves, that decay that makes rainforests smell so damn good, that you hunger for it, if you have been absent a long time. The dry down has a violet element that makes me think of twilight in the deep scrub. Spooky-beautiful.

name: Aron Finch
review: Having worn this more and more, it's a fragrance definitely possessing it's own personality. The cedar is so strong and woody that it envelopes me inside my own olfactory bubble. It's very rich and deep.

name: Gleen Richardo
review: Please don't fall sick. It's nauseating, headache inducing, super synthetic, not even close to black afgano. Never dig your nose into it, try smelling it in the air it's whiffs if only you wish to check it out. Still many would not want this trouble and would want to get rid off this. Better buy MPF black oud it gives you the sweet and calm feel.
